ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I got to review the basics of drawing and receive feedback during crits. I also was able to learn new skills from using a variety of different products (oculus, laser cutting, procreate, etc.)
I learned about abstraction, laser printing, and how to use Adobe fresco. I also learned to effectively communicate about artistic works in a way that emphasizes experience over visual narrative.
I was introduced to different digital drawing tools (Fresco, Procreate, Gravity Sketch/Tilt brush, laser cutting)
I developed a sense of drawing which I hadn't had before

Basic drawing skills such as line work, shading, and volume, as well as different modes of digital art including Adobe Fresco, Animation on Procreate, laser cutting, and 3-D drawing via virtual reality.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I think this course was strong in that it was well organized and i liked being able to work with a variety of different tools. I think it could be improved in having a more structured syllabus in the beginning of the course.

Strengths:
We learned a lot and it was a very fun and accepting atmosphere. The teachers and students communicated very freely and we had a lot of freedom in our works.
Weaknesses:
Sometimes there's a lot of waiting around.

Strengths - flexibility of assignments and access to different technologies (iPad, VR headset, laser cutting machine, etc). Weaknesses - use of software is not taught in detail and critiques take a lot of time. More tutorials or in-class workshops for using each program (and more features within each program) would be useful

Strengths were variety

Weaknesses were that it wasn't as indepth as it could have been.

Professor Vossoughi is very knowledgeable and excited to teach students the new areas of digital drawing. Occasionally we ran into issues such as sharing 3-D work and there was some down-time during class in terms of setting up devices. If those could be done more efficiently, either by giving students instructions to do them at home or having them set up ahead of time, there would be more class time for other projects potentially.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes - i think this course is a great survey of digital drawing.
Yes but I would suggest to seek more opportunities to use the various technologies outside of the regular assignments
Yes it's a great introduction to art

I encourage any Yale student to take at least one art class before you graduate and this is a great entry-level class where students of any skill in art can learn a lot and try different modes of art.
